member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.WinUICore.IUIElement.Measure(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Measures the element and updates the property.
member.param: The object to use for measurement.

The available size that parent can give to the child. The child can return bigger in hopes that the parent will become scrollable. The value may also be infinity to indicate that the desired measurements of the element are wanted.
member.remarks: The method should be called by parents on their children. Internally, calls the MeasureCore override on the same object, giving it opportunity to compute its . This method will return immediately if the child's measurements are valid, previously measured and availableSize is the same as cached. This method also resets the bit on the child.

member.summary: Measures the element and updates the property.
member.param: The object to use for measurement.

The available size that parent can give to the child. The child can return bigger in hopes that the parent will become scrollable. The value may also be infinity to indicate that the desired measurements of the element are wanted.
member.remarks: The method should be called by parents on their children. Internally, calls the override on the same object, giving it opportunity to compute its . This method will return immediately if the child's measurements are valid, previously measured and availableSize is the same as cached. This method also resets the bit on the child.

member.summary: Measures the size in layout required for child elements and determines a size for the element itself.
member.param: The object to use for measurement.

member.returns: The size that this element determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of child element sizes.
member.remarks: Element authors should override this method, call on each visible child element and determine the total size required.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.WinUICore.UIContainerControl.UpdateLayout
member.summary: Call this method to ensure that the whole subtree of elements that includes this is properly updated.
member.remarks: This ensures that objects with invalid measure or arrange states will get a call to their and methods, and all computed sizes will be validated. This method does nothing if layout is clean but it does work if layout is not clean so avoid calling it after each change in the element tree. It makes sense to either never call it (system will do this in a deferred manner) or only call it if you absolutely need updated sizes and positions after you do all changes.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.WinUICore.UIElement.UpdateLayout
member.summary: Call this method to ensure that the whole subtree of elements that includes this is properly updated.
member.remarks: This ensures that objects with invalid measure or arrange states will get a call to their and methods, and all computed sizes will be validated. This method does nothing if layout is clean but it does work if layout is not clean so avoid calling it after each change in the element tree. It makes sense to either never call it (system will do this in a deferred manner) or only call it if you absolutely need updated sizes and positions after you do all changes.

member.value: The gradient scale.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Drawing.TwoColorLinearGradientStyle
member.summary: Specifies the type of gradient effect to apply to a .

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Drawing.TwoColorLinearGradientStyle.Normal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient that starts with the start color at one edge and ends with the end color at the opposite edge.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Drawing.TwoColorLinearGradientStyle.TriangleBump
member.summary: Specifies a gradient that starts the end color at the center point of the gradient and performs a triangle shaped linear falloff to the edges of the gradient using the start color.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Drawing.TwoColorLinearGradientStyle.SigmaBellBump
member.summary: Specifies a gradient that starts the end color at the center point of the gradient and performs a sigma bell-shaped linear falloff to the edges of the gradient using the start color.

member.summary: A base class for exceptions thrown from Actipro products.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.ComponentModel.ExceptionBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ExceptionBase class.
member.remarks: This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "An application error has occurred." This message takes into account the current system culture.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.ComponentModel.ExceptionBase.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ExceptionBase class with a specified error message.
member.param: A message that describes the error.
member.remarks: The content of the parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.ComponentModel.ExceptionBase.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ExceptionBase class with serialized data.
member.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
member.remarks: This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.ComponentModel.ExceptionBase.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ExceptionBase class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception..
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

remarks.para: The content of the parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the InnerException property. The InnerException property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or if the InnerException property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
